properties.areaDesc: Lawrence, IL; Crawford, IL; Knox, IN; Sullivan, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 10:52AM EST until February 19 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Driftwood River...East Fork White River...White River...Wabash
River...


...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has upgraded the
flood category from Minor to Moderate severity for the following
rivers and streams

Mississinewa River near Ridgeville


.Precipitation of up to about 2 inches fell Sunday into Monday,
heaviest within 50 miles north and south of Interstate 70.
This is leading to mainly lowland flooding, but some county, state,
and federal roads may be impacted.  The Mississinewa River near
Ridgeville will come near or perhaps onto State Road 1 near State
Road 28.

Flooding is expected to occur at several locations on the Wabash
River from Montezuma southward and on the White River from Centerton
southward.  Flooding along the lower reaches will last past February
20.

Flooding on the Driftwood River is expected to last no more than a
couple days.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Wabash River at Riverton.
* from Tuesday morning to Wednesday February 19.
* At 10:00 AM Monday the stage was 13.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Tuesday morning and continue
to rise to near 16.9 feet by Sunday afternoon.  It will fall below
flood stage by Tuesday February 18.
* At 18.0 feet...Extensive lowland flooding is in progress.  High
water surrounds many river cabins.  Access to most river cabins is
by boat only.  Levees begin to protect farmland.  Extensive
flooding of Leaverton Park occurs in Palestine, Illinois.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
